sage.camera.controllers

Class ThirdPersonChaseCameraController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.controllers.AbstractCameraController
      • sage.camera.controllers.ThirdPersonChaseCameraController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICameraController

    public class ThirdPersonChaseCameraController
extends AbstractCameraController
    This class extends the AbstractCameraController class. This class controls the virtual ICamera such that it functions as a "third-person chase camera" common in third-person video games such as racing games. This class controls the position and orientation of the camera such that it "chases" the camera controllers SceneNode target as it moves around the game world, and it has an implementation of a spring system that can be enabled to smooth out the repositioning of the camera's position. The controller does NOT control the position of the target which it is attached to.

    Reference: XNA tutorial project for a chase camera found here.

    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static graphicslib3D.Vector3D DEFAULT_CAMERA_POSITION_OFFSET
      The default value for the offset from the target look at position which determines the point at which the camera's position is set.
      static graphicslib3D.Vector3D DEFAULT_TARGET_LOOKAT_OFFSET
      The default value for the offset from the target which determines the point at which the camera looks.

        Parameters:
        camera - - The camera to control
        target - - The target the controller is attached to
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        inputControllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the third-person orbit camera

    • Method Detail

      • getIsSpringSystemEnabled

        public boolean getIsSpringSystemEnabled()
        Returns TRUE if the camera controller's spring system is enabled; otherwise it returns FALSE.

      • enableSpringSystem

        public void enableSpringSystem()
        Enables the camera controller's spring system.

      • disableSpringSystem

        public void disableSpringSystem()
        Disables the camera controller's spring system.

      • getSpringConstant

        public float getSpringConstant()
        Returns the spring constant being used in the spring system of the camera controller.

        The spring constant (also called the stiffness constant) controls the influence of the camera's position over the spring force. The stiffer the spring constant the closer the camera will stay to the chased object.

      • setSpringConstant

        public void setSpringConstant(float springConstant)
        Sets the spring constant to be used in the camera controller's spring system.

        The spring constant (also called the stiffness constant) controls the influence of the camera's position over the spring force. The stiffer the spring constant the closer the camera will stay to the chased object.

        Parameters:
        springConstant - - A value that is greater than or equal to 0. If a value less than 0 is passed in the spring constant is set to 1.

      • getDampingConstant

        public float getDampingConstant()
        Returns the damping constant being used in the spring system of the camera controller.

        The damping constant approximates the internal friction of the spring. Sufficient damping will prevent the spring from oscillating infinitely.

      • setDampingConstant

        public void setDampingConstant(float dampingConstant)
        Sets the damping constant to be used in the camera controller's spring system.

        The damping constant approximates the internal friction of the spring. Sufficient damping will prevent the spring from oscillating infinitely.

        Parameters:
        dampingConstant - - A value that is greater than or equal to 0. If a value less than 0 is passed in the damping constant is set to 1.

      • getCameraMass

        public float getCameraMass()
        Returns the mass of the camera body.

        Larger mass objects require stiffer springs with less damping to move at the same rate as smaller mass objects.

      • setCameraMass

        public void setCameraMass(float mass)
        Sets the mass of the camera body.

        Larger mass objects require stiffer springs with less damping to move at the same rate as smaller mass objects.

        Parameters:
        mass - - The mass which must be a value greater than zero.

      • getTargetLookAtOffset

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getTargetLookAtOffset()
        Returns the target offset; that is, the offset amount in the world "up" direction above the target SceneNode which defines the point at which the camera looks.
        Returns:
        the target look at offset

      • setTargetLookAtOffset

        public void setTargetLookAtOffset(graphicslib3D.Vector3D targetLookAtOffset)
        Parameters:
        targetLookAtOffset - A Vector3D specifying the offset from the target SceneNode where the camera should point

      • getCameraPositionOffset

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getCameraPositionOffset()
        Returns the camera position offset. This is the offset relative to the camera look at position at which the camera position should be set.

      • setCameraPositionOffset

        public void setCameraPositionOffset(graphicslib3D.Vector3D cameraPositionOffset)
        Sets the camera position offset.
        Parameters:
        cameraPositionOffset - - A Vector3D specifying the offset from the target look at position at which the camera position should be set.

      • setInputMode

        public void setInputMode(IInputManager inputMgr,
                         java.lang.String controllerName)
        Sets which input controller the camera controller will use to manipulate the camera.
        Parameters:
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        controllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the third-person orbit camera

      • update

        public void update(float time)
        Updates this ThirdPersonChaseCameraController by determining the current target position, setting a new camera position based on the target position and the physics calculations for used for the spring system, and forcing the camera to look at the target node from its new position. This method should be called (directly or indirectly) once each time around the application's game loop.
        Parameters:
        time - - amount of time since last update, in msec
